titleStmt.title: Glosses on Isidore, Etymologiae in Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Lat. 7670

revisionDesc.change: Manually updated: The revisionDesc section was manually introduced to this file's TEI header.

Manually annotated: Lemmata were manually identified before the development of the GlossCorpus lemma assignment tool. This work predates the introduction of a revision history into GlossCorpus TEI files; hence, the date of this change is tied to the date on which a revision history was introduced for this file. Tags and notes introduced during the manual lemma assignment may remain in this text file.

note.gloss: aliter monstrant in prolatione et aliter possunt intellegi
IEPASTIA NOMOC id est quasi sine principali lege
note.note: "quasi sine lege" written in Tironian notes.
"signum salutantis vel saltandi" written in Tironian notes.
"ruina sua et civitatis" written in Tironian notes.
"quia ipse initium et finis" written in Tironian notes.

note.gloss: quasi fontialis quia ab ipsa litterae sunt inventae
note.note: "quasi quia ab ipsa litterae sunt inventae" written in Tironian notes.
"nomen Graecum apud Romanos" written in Tironian notes.
"rei gestae narrationes" written in Tironian notes.

note.gloss: id est importuna et superflua locutio

note.note: The form interponuntur looks like an incorrect resolution of an abbreviated verb (see imponuntur in Orleans296)

note.gloss: id est trans, id est formatio
quia nec perfecte barbarismus est, quoniam pro necessitate fit metri, nec perfecte Latinitas, quia corruptio unius verbi, ideoque inter perfectam et imperfectam locutionem dicitur esse metaplasmus
aves lp quae fi e habentes alas
ille patrius amor non potuit requiescere
illos, id est Aeneam et Achaten

note.note: A notable error of the glossator: the Punes lived in north Africa not in Italy

note.gloss: exceptis his auctoritatibus superius dictis sciendum est
id est comma, id est colon

note.note: A duplicate of a gloss already attached to the same lemma
Duplicates information already attached to the same lemma

note.gloss: annui commentarii dicuntur qui ea quae per annos gerebantur, scribebant
